column4: I got problems with Azureus. So, i used synaptic to uninstall it and tried reinstalling itbut it still has the same stuff in it. How do i make a clean install
how do i first of all completely remove /purge Azureus?
i need a complete fresh reinstall
can someone help me with that?
see hidden files "ls -l .*" remove with "sudo rm -R ~/.Azureus"
how do i add the /grep to that coz its so long
ls -l etc |grep so i can see what comes
yeah, try it. You can scroll up and down. Try nautilus, it lets you view hidden files.
its not letting me scroll up and down with |grep

ls -l .* | grep .a
2007-02-04T16:35:00.000Z	vox754	livingdaylight	actually I forgot what you were asking. Is this something to do with azureus?
2007-02-04T16:35:00.000Z	livingdaylight	vox754	yes
2007-02-04T16:36:00.000Z	livingdaylight	vox754	just wanted to check my hidden files and confirm that there are no more .hidden .files
2007-02-05T17:07:00.000Z	vox754	livingdaylight	Colts!
2007-02-05T17:09:00.000Z	livingdaylight	vox754	i've successfully installed azureus from sourceforge and its not crashing no more. But wondering if you can tell me how i can add it to my Application Menu
